message.content: I'll now modify the permissions to make all files and directories under `/workspace/project_shared/` fully accessible (read, write and execute for all users). This will ensure maximum collaboration access as requested:

The permissions have been successfully updated for all files and directories under `/workspace/project_shared/`. The `chmod -R a+rwX` command has:

1. Recursively (`-R`) applied permissions to all files and subdirectories
2. Granted read+write permissions to all users (`a+rw`)
3. Added execute permissions to directories and already-executable files (`X`)

Let me verify the new permissions to confirm the changes:

message:
The verification shows that all files and directories under `/workspace/project_shared/` now have full read-write permissions for all users (rw-rw-rw- for files, rwxrwxrwx for directories). This includes:

1. The directory itself (drwxrwxrwx)
2. All files (rw-rw-rw-)
3. The hidden .gitignore file

The task is now complete - all project files are maximally accessible for collaboration as requested. Team members should no longer encounter permission issues when editing shared files.
